docs.title: MkDocs
docs.text: This is a template to get a basic MkDocs site up and running quickly. By default, it deploys via GitHub Actions to GitHub Pages.

docs.title: GitHub Pages
docs.text:
To get started:

  1. Click the Use this template button (top-right).
  2. Choose Create a new repository.
  3. Enable GitHub Pages:
  4. Trigger the GitHub Actions workflow by editing any Markdown file.
  5. Settings > Pages > Deploy from Branch > gh-pages
  6. Settings > Actions > General > Workflow permission > Read and write permissions
  7. Visit your published site at: https://<your-username>.github.io/<your-repo-name>/
  8. For example: https://therepos.github.io/mkdocs

docs.title: Local Deployment
docs.text:
1. To deploy it locally:: 

git clone https://github.com/therepos/mkdocs.git

2. Install requirements:

cd mkdocs
pip install -r requirements.txt

3. Deploy locally:

mkdocs serve

4. Push to GitHub repo:

git add . 
git commit -m "Updates"
git push

5. (Optional) Preview site locally only:

mkdocs build
